alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Norfolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 11:50AM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Assabet River At Maynard affecting Worcester and Middlesex Counties. Shawsheen River Near Wilmington affecting Essex and Middlesex Counties. Charles River At Dover affecting Norfolk and Middlesex Counties. For the Assabet River...including Maynard...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Charles River...including Dover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Charles River at Dover. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding will affect a few homes in Needham along Fisher Street, as well as a portion of Route 109 at the Medfield and Millis town line. Some flooding is also likely on the South Natick and Wellesley town line along River Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EST Wednesday was 5.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 6.1 feet Saturday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at midnight EST.
